notes: TJ generation features part-time 4WD with live axles front and rear. Trim levels include SE, Sport, Sahara, and Rubicon (introduced 2003 with Dana 44 axles and locking differentials). 2004 introduced Unlimited long-wheelbase variant with 10-inch stretch. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep Wrangler (TJ) article, January 2025 revision.

JK generation introduced first-ever 4-door Wrangler Unlimited. Features part-time 4WD with electronic stability control standard. Trim levels include X/Sport, Sahara, and Rubicon. Optional rear-wheel drive (4x2) available on some models. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep Wrangler (JK) article, January 2025 revision.

WJ generation features UniFrame construction for improved rigidity. Quadra-Drive and Quadra-Trac II 4WD systems available. Trim levels include Laredo, Limited, Sport, Special Edition, and Overland. Trail Rated 4X4 certification introduced in 2004. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep Grand Cherokee (WJ) article, January 2025 revision.

WK generation introduced available 3.0L Mercedes-Benz CRD diesel (2007-2008 only) with 376 lb-ft torque, requiring diesel service expertise including emissions system maintenance. Quadra-Drive II 4WD system available. High-performance SRT-8 variant features 6.1L HEMI with performance suspension. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep Grand Cherokee (WK) article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 2.8L VM Motori R428 I4 Turbo Diesel CRD (160 hp, 2005-2006)
notes: KJ generation Liberty featured available 2.8L CRD turbo diesel (2005-2006 only in Sport and Limited trims) with 295 lb-ft torque, requiring diesel service expertise. 4WD options include Command-Trac (part-time) and Selec-Trac (full-time). Trim levels include Sport, Renegade, and Limited. Diesel option discontinued due to emissions standards. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep Liberty (KJ) article, January 2025 revision.

KK generation Liberty features updated styling with available 4WD system. Standard features include electronic stability control, traction control, and anti-lock brakes. 6-speed manual transmission dropped after 2008. Trim levels include Sport and Limited. Towing capacity rated at 5,000 lbs. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep Liberty (KK) article, January 2025 revision.

First-generation Compass (MK49) built on GS platform shared with Dodge Caliber. Targets first-time Jeep buyers and primarily on-road driving. Optional 4WD system available. CVT transmission option provides continuous ratio variation for improved fuel economy. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep Compass article, January 2025 revision.

First-generation Patriot (MK74) built on GS platform shared with Compass and Dodge Caliber. Debuted at 2006 New York Auto Show. 4WD available with Freedom Drive I system. More rugged styling than Compass aimed at traditional Jeep buyers. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep Patriot article, January 2025 revision.

XK Commander built on WK Grand Cherokee platform with three-row seating for 5 or 7 passengers. 4WD options include Quadra-Trac I (full-time), Quadra-Trac II (full-time with low range), and Quadra-Drive II (adds electronic limited-slip differentials). 5.7L HEMI output increased from 330 hp to 360 hp during production. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep Commander (XK) article, January 2025 revision.
